body: Suggest we close this PR in favor of my second PR that addresses all the .p4ignore files.
Need to update first commit from HAWQ-13 to HAWQ-18

@cwelton we are aware of the hawq_toolkit view and it is tracked by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HAWQ-10. Lirong mentioned he already has the fix in his local repo and will get to it.

Pushed to git in Apache
Nice catch with the closeForRead in ReadBridge
+1 on the updates to support new version of hdfs,hbase and hive for HAWQ-5
Please enable test case "errortbl" in install check good. It was disabled when gpfdist was disabled.
The removal of the obsolete HAWQ management scripts seems good. +1
Looks good to me since we have new hawq command.
I have gone thru gpactivatestandby gpinitstandby gpinitsystem gpseginstall lib/gpcreateseg.sh lib/gpinitsegment lib/gpseginitsb.sh scripts. Its good to remove from current package. +1
The changes present look good.  Mostly the questions I have are around the things that are left, gpaddmirrors, gpexpand, gpstart, gpstop, gpstate, gprecoverseg, gpmigrator_mirror, gpmovemirrors.
Thanks all for the review. The other legacy scripts will be remove batch by batch. Just be careful if it might cause some problem.
Except these issues mentioned before by Caleb and myself, the logic of the modifications looks good to me.
@jianlirong You should also have an upgrade path for existing customer using older HAWQ versions that does not have "hcatalog". I think the file you changed is only run during initdb?

@jimmida 
I haven't started to think about 'hcatalog' feature's impact for gpmigrator. Some points need to be thinked:
1) If old db instance already has db named 'hcatalog':  maybe we should rename it?
2) Add a new meta for 'hcatalog' in pg_database: Done.
3) Skipping 'hcatalog'  for any db loop processing. Because this affected by the solution for point 1), so I haven't fixed it. However this behavior works fine in this version's upgrade, it will have problem when next version's upgrade.

But for this defect, this fix is okay, because the function PerformPostUpgrade() in gpMigratorUtil.py calls gp_toolkit.sql.

Below two changes look good. +1
1. For each relation, search it in all entries (instead of only the first one) in range relations list to get its corresponding base relation information (i.e., relation type (random/hash).
2. Correct the calculation of locus description of hash tables when there are no resource allocated for them.
I have fixed the errormessage comments and renamed queue name column of pg_resqueue from "name" to "rsqname".
@liming01 - we have a story to cover the upgrade scenario for Hcatalog.

@liming01 really good points for (1). I'm not sure what versions you are referring to in (3). What I was getting at was that for users upgrading from 1.3.x to 2.x, the hawq_toolkit view should also be CREATE OR REPLACE'd. But if we have a bigger story for upgrade c.f. @GodenYao, we can be more confident on the use case.

> 1) implement new CREATE/ALTER RESOURCE QUEUE attributes;

I went to look for what these changes were so that I could update the jira description accordingly and noticed that you haven't updated {{./doc/src/sgml/ref/create_resource_queue.sgml}}, which means that the command line help won't be accurate in psql.
+1. The modifications look good to me.
Code is almost good except the space issue. +1
Code is good to me except indent issue. +1

Code will be OK after fixing some style issues. 
1) should not mix tab and space.
2) "else" should not start a new line.

+1
I reviewed the code changes, They are ok to me.

As the JIRA description suggested, the strategy of this fix is to let the partition child table with the largest data size decide whether all other partition child tables should be transformed from hash to random.

According to this definition, this fix is OK to me. +1.

Removal of dfs_namenode, dfs_namenode_port, and dfs_space loos good. +1
1. In non-HA mode, dfs_url is good enough, so we don't need dfs_namenode, dfs_namenode_port, and dfs_space.
2. In HA mode, we don't need dfs_namenode, dfs_namenode_port, and dfs_space as well.

+1. 
Please update automation tests to reflect this fix.
@hornn I've already created a pull request for the automation test https://stash.eng.pivotal.io/projects/HDQA/repos/pxf_automation/pull-requests/21
The improvement looks good. The example using quicklz to show the usage of ADDON_DIR is great. +1
+1 The code change is good to me.
Update error manage to ERROR: failed to acquire resource because of expecting too many virtual segments.
Looks good, except some code indent.
+1 look good to me since it need to comparable with code.

+1
I am ok to the changes.
The fix is good to me. +1
Karthi, I think you need to specify the jira number in the format [HAWQ-51] no spaces etc for the pull request to be automatically linked to the jira. Otherwise, there's no notification in the jira.
+! since limited segment will impact performance

remove the forbid_optimizer and enable hash to random in gpopt. 
+1
+1 when more than two nodes are down, rm will reject  resource request.
According to test result, it should be use hash as default. +1
